programme.title: Nazi Law: Legally Blind
programme.desc: Dictator Adolf Hitler revoked citizenship rights for German Jews and deprived many others of their rights.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: Hitler’s fascination with propaganda was born in the trenches of WWI. Then he refined it to win Germany.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: Hitler’s approach to propaganda was one of persuasion and terror, all in service of the Führer.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: This episode investigates the role propaganda played for both Hitler and the Allies to mobilize for war.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine

programme.desc: This documentary explain how a system so quickly became the rationalized apparatus of genocide.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The race for new discoveries led an institution to carry out countless acts of barbarism.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.sub-title: The Banker Of The Third Reich
programme.desc: Hjalmar Schacht is a largely forgotten figure. And yet, Hitler’s rise to power depended on him.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Mexico
programme.desc: The Spanish Conquest produced 300 years of colonial rule, dividing Mexico with a class system still in effect.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Mexico
programme.desc: The War of Independence charts Mexico's fight to break free from Spain after years of instability.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Mexico
programme.desc: Explore the conflict between church and state which led to Mexico's civil war, and the fight for power.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Mexico
programme.desc: The Mexican Revolution achieved the foundations of a modern Mexican state and its diverse culture.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Los Angeles

programme.title: Empire Builders: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Many diverse forces shaped L.A., bringing cultural richness and tensions, and making it a global arts hub.
